title: Chrysanthi Unicode Mono in Scribus?
content:
Hi all!

You created your Chrysanthi Unicode Monospace font by Font Creator, but when you try to test it in Scribus, you get excessive spacing.

Unicode range coverage:  
Basic Latin (complete in both fonts)  
Latin-1 Supplement (complete in both fonts)  
Latin Extended-A (complete in both fonts)  
Latin Extended-B (incomplete in proportional, complete in monospace for 5.0) i  
(proportional font only) These characters are not part of the Unicode Standard, and have been mapped to private use sectors 0234 – 0237. These characters are used in the Tsœxisca language. I have also mapped a capital and lower-case ezh to 0220 and 0221, respectively.

IPA Extensions (incomplete in proportional, complete in monospace for 5.0)  
Spacing Modifier Letters (incomplete in proportional, complete in monospace for 5.0)  
Combining Diacritics (incomplete in proportional, complete in monospace for 5.0) ii

(proportional font only) Because this is not a fixed width font, the combining marks will not line up precisely with all characters. I have tried to make them line up as well as possible with as many characters as possible.

Greek (incomplete in proportional, complete in monospace for 5.0) iii  
(proportional font only) Missing Variant Letter Forms, Archaic Letters, Coptic-unique letters, and Additions subsets [03D0-03F3]

Cyrillic (incomplete in proportional, complete in monospace for 5.0)  
Cyrillic Supplement (complete in monospace for 5.0)  
Armenian (complete in both fonts)  
Hebrew (incomplete in proportional, complete in monospace) \* iv  
(proportional font only) Missing Cantillation Marks subset [0590-05AF]

Arabic (experiencing technical difficulties in proportional, complete in monospace) \* v  
(proportional font only) Missing 060C, 0653, 0654, 0655, 066C, 0680-06FE. Keeps printing out as Ariel Unicode, as do most of the subsets marked “technical difficulty.”)

Syriac (unavailable in proportional, complete in monospace) \*  
Arabic Supplement (unavailable in both fonts)  
Thaana (unavailable in both fonts ) \*  
NKo (unavailable in both fonts) \*  
Devanagari (experiencing technical difficulties in proportional, complete in monospace) \* vi

(proportional font only) These characters are mapped to the devanagari subset, which doesn’t seem to work in Windows 2000, and also to the Private use subset from E900 to E97F.

(proportional font only ) These characters are mapped to the runic subset, which doesn’t seem to work, and also to the Private use subset from E6A0 to E6F0.

(monospace font only) These characters are mapped to the letterlike symbols subset, which seems to have excessive spacing in Windows.

(proportional font only) Yin-yang patterns for Taoist medicine added to 25F9 though 25FF. Decorative glyphs added to 2614 through 2617. Zodiac wheel added to 2618. Private use area 2672 through 267F mapped as follows: 2672 - pentagram, 2673 - inverted pentagram, 2674 - tripple goddess moon, 2675 - dharma wheel, 2676 - fire glyph, 2677 - air glyph, 2678 - earth glyph, 2679 - water glyph, 267A - akasha glyph, 267B inverted akasha glyph, 267C - three triangles, 267D - three overlapping circles, 267E - five overlapping circles, 267F - three pointed circle.
